result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald L Wiley

defendant.name: Wiley, Donald L

records.addlTxt: to Transport for Court on December 15, 2022 at 2:15 PM

3:57 PM Defendant Donald L Wiley in court in custody transported from Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Donald L Wiley.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
State - calls Deputy Greg Moen.  Witness is sworn in and testifies.  Witness identifies defendant.
Atty Yonko - cross examines witness.  Court - questions witness.
4:02 PM witness is excused.
Parties have no further witnesses 
State - argues for Court to find probable cause.  Atty Yonko - argues.  Court - finds probable cause and binds DE over for trial.  
Atty Yonko - moves to withdraw due to closing Law Firm.  Asks for status hearing to be set rather than an ARGN.
DE - will be incarcerated at Jackson Correctional until April 2023.  Court - will reschedule next date if counsel appointed is not available.  Atty Yonko - DE requested to be in person for all hearings.  
State - will file Order for Transport.
Status hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Status hearing on December 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

11:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Donald L Wiley appeared by video from Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko appeared by video for Donald L Wiley. V. Girard - Clerk 
Atty Yonko - asks to set a prelim & deft wants to be in person
Deft - has 8 months left
Court - bond cont
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
